description.narrative:
Projektet avser att hjälpa Bosnien och Hercegovina att definiera och implementera SDG-målen / 2030-Agendan till handling genom att samla relevanta partner kring SDG ”Roadmap” - en agenda med en tydlig vision för landet.
Projektet har för syfte att bygga kapacitet och förbereda privata och offentliga partners i Bosnien och Hercegovina för genomförandet av SDGs, med två följande effektmål: 1. SDGs ”Roadmap” för BiH utvecklas och att genomförandet påbörjades. 2. att privat sektor aktörer är sensibiliserad och engagerad i SDGs prioritering, planering och genomförande.

The project aims to capacitate and prepare private and public sector partners in Bosnia and Herzegovina for the SDGs implementation, thus directly supporting Bosnia and Herzegovina’s efforts to contribute to the largest global agenda that exists today – Agenda 2030.

tag.narrative: 17.14 - Enhance policy coherence for sustainable development.
17.14 - Föra en mer samstämmig politik för hållbar utveckling.

17.16 - Enhance the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development, complemented by multi-stakeholder partnerships that mobilize and share knowledge, expertise, technology and financial resources, to support the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals in all countries, in particular developing countries

description.narrative: Last year, the first Volontary National Review (VNR) was finalised and presented at the High-Level Political Forum in New York and the VNR was thereafter adopted by all levels of BiH governments. This success was followed by the design of the SDG Framework in BiH through a highly participatory process by the SDG Framework Sub-Group. The SDG Framework is to be seen as a roadmap that defines the joint 2030 vision for all government levels in the country, key development pathways, accelerators and drivers, linked with domesticated SDG targets and indicators with baselines and target values. It also defines institutional arrangements for implementation, monitoring and reporting. The Framework document was ready for final consultations foreseen in April 2020 but due to the COVID-19 outbreak, this has been postponed until Autumn. Due to the pandemic, the SDG Framework Sub-Group decided to review the priorities set in the document against the new realities caused by the COVID-19 pandemic as well as by reassessing the feasibility of achieving the SDG targets, particularly in the mid-term period. The document has therefore been adjusted accordingly. After public consultation and once completed, the SDG Framework will be submitted for adoption by the BiH Council of Ministers, entity governments and the Government of Brcko District. The first SDG Business Week held in June 2019 was a flagship event that provided avenue for learning and exchange with global, regional and local SDG leaders. The digital part of the SDG Business Week gathered extraordinary speakers who presented to 3500+ viewers on-line and 200+ students at 2 universities in BiH on 3 key themes (Business 2030, Planet 2030 and Jobs 2030). The implementation of the second project outcome, private secor engagement, has also been largely affected by the pandemic but has managed to cope with it and adjust its activities somewhat. The SDG buisness week 2020 has been postphoned from June til October and will take place online. This year 106 applications were submitted for the SDG buisness award compared to 55 last year which is a good indicator of project visibility and good communication. Despite the pandemic, the Project continued to engage businesses by organizing events that served as platforms for the exchange of experiences and sensitizing the private sector on the importance of the Agenda 2030. The SDG Accelerator for small and medium enterprises (SMEs) for selected companies from the country was successfully launched in the beginning of March. 24 companies applied and the Project selected 5 SMEs to be part of the SDG Accelerator. This six months Innovation Journey has been slighly delayed because of the pandemic, but a lot of the SDG coaching has been done online.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
